lead_paragraph: To the Editor: During the Nicaraguan presidential campaign (news article, Nov. 6), the United States made clear that a victory by Daniel Ortega, the leftist Sandinista candidate, would compromise American relations with Nicaragua and lead to a possible cutoff of aid. In the 1980's, Washington spent hundreds of millions of dollars to overthrow the Sandinistas, and thousands of civilians died. Over the last decade we spent far less to help reconstruct Nicaragua than we did to foment war. Yet we are still dictating terms to a country whose free elections are a model for its neighbors.
abstract: Antonio J Dajer letter on Novï
